DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication whether or not the patient consented to specimen storage and future use.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disposition Domain Biospecimen Storage And Future Use Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A time that is yet to come._To put into action or service._Permission to do something.

Property.preferredName: Biospecimen Storage And Future Use Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A time that is yet to come.:To put into action or service.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A time that is yet to come.
To put into action or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient has given permission
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her sample(s) for use in future health research:

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the participant agree to continue to share previously donated blood and tissue?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree that my samples and related health information may be kept in a biobank for use in future health research.
